tips.acl: The provided content is a PUBLIC configuration. Leave blank for PRIVATE. Don't forget to configure CORS on your bucket. <0>See Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).</0>

connect_to_local.cloud: It looks like you're trying to connect to a database that's local to your machine or part of a private network. It might not work in the ILLA Cloud version. Check out our <0>docs</0> for how to the self-host version.
connect_to_local.selfhost: It looks like you're trying to connect to a database that's local to your machine. Please use the local area network IP address of the machine instead of "localhost" or "127.0.0.1".

verification_mode.skip_ca_certificate: Your server may be vulnerable to attacks.

gs.private_key:
Used to connect to Google Sheets. Click <0>here</0> to create a project and get the OAuth credential. With service account authentication, we will only have access to spreadsheets you share with the email address corresponding to the service account used. See <1>here</1> for documentation on creating a service account and access key.

Users might experience limits from different processing components not controlled by Sheets. Learn more about the <2>quota limits</2>
gs.leave_blank_to_selec: Leave blank to select the first sheet
gs.to_select_the_first_: To select the first five cells in the first column of a sheet titled sheet1, A1 notation is sheet1!A1:A5. <0>See Google's docs for more information. </0>
gs.a1_notation: To select the first five cells in the first column of a sheet titled sheet1, A1 notation is sheet1!A1:A5. <0>See Google's docs for more information. </0>
gs.sheet_id_to_copy: Find this by looking at the ?gid=123123 in the URL of your Google sheets

tidb.ca_certificate: We fill in the CA Certificate used for TLS Connections to Serverless Tier by default. If you need TLS Connections to Dedicated Tier, <0>Click here</0> to view the configuration method.

neon.normal: Create a Neon project and get the string in <0>project dashboard</0>.
neon.failed: Failed to parse the string. Please check your string or configure manually.
neon.no_password: The string has no password. Please display the password in the Neon dashboard before copying.

clickhouse.ssl: When using ClickHouse Cloud Service, it is recommended to turn on the SSL.

action_type.copy_a_single_sheet_: Copy a single sheet to another spreadsheet

advanced.show_a_loading_page_: Show a loading page on page load

trigger.on_change: Run action automatically when inputs change

tip.connect_type: Cloud: ILLA servers will securely connect to your database.
tip.name: The name for resource when creating actions in the ILLA.
tip.private_key: <0>Click here</0> to see how to obtain this key
tip.username_password: Credentials will be encrypted & stored securely on our servers.
tip.introspection: Turn on this if your GraphQL endpoint does not support introspection queries. Note that disabling introspection reduces the usability of GraphQL, as auto-complete and linting for this resource will no longer work.

tip.configure_oauth2: OAuth 2.0 is a complex spec. ILLA currently supports the server-side OAuth 2.0 authentication flow as well as the Client Credentials flow. In both cases, you must use the OAUTH2_TOKEN placeholder in order to inform ILLA where to place the OAuth access token in the API request. A common location for this is as a header such as Authorization: Bearer OAUTH2_TOKEN.
tip.extra_body_values: Extra body values are not passed for GET or HEAD requests
tip.get_req_auto_run: (GET REQ) WILL RUN AUTOMATICALLY WHENEVER A PARAMETER CHANGES.
tip.name: The name for resource when creating actions in the ILLA.

tip.custome_s3_endpoint_tip: This is used to connect to other non-S3 services, like Digital Ocean Spaces or Wasabi.

initial_value.tooltips: Supports objects or primitive values. Example: { count: 0 }

display_name.validate_error: "{{ displayName }}" must start with a letter or "_", and can only contain letters, numbers, "_", or "$"

event_handler_list.title: Edit event handler

setter_label.alt_text_desc: An accessible description of the image for screen readers. This is also rendered as a fallback if the image fails to load.
setter_label.caption: Caption
setter_label.label: Label
setter_label.title: Title
setter_label.name: Name

setter_tooltip.action: Your actions to components trigger queries, control components, or call the data in your resources. Multiple async actions will be executed in parallel.
setter_tooltip.cascader_data: Each option must be JSON format and contain two keys, value and label. By using arrays, you can create options at the same level. And child options can be created by using "children" attribute.
setter_tooltip.component_default_value: The initial value of the component. You can dynamically change the initial value by typing JavaScript in {{}}.
setter_tooltip.custom_rule: Create your validation logic here. The rules should be made in JavaScript and covered by {{}}.
setter_tooltip.date_format: A valid date format string. See [dayJS](https://day.js.org/docs/en/parse/string-format).
setter_tooltip.default_value: The initial value of the input box. You can dynamically change the initial value of the input field by typing JavaScript in {{}}.
setter_tooltip.disabled: Control the status of whether the component is disabled. The component cannot be modified or focused when it is disabled.
setter_tooltip.disabled_submit: When disabled, the components that call the form.submit() method will also be disabled.
setter_tooltip.form_data_key: Specify a key of a wrapping form component when constructing the data attribute.
setter_tooltip.hidden: Dynamically control whether the component is hidden. You can change the hidden status through dynamical boolean value.
setter_tooltip.hide_validation_message: You can hide the error message by switching the hidden status when the input value is incorrect. You can dynamically change the hidden status by JavaScript.
setter_tooltip.input_default_value: The initial value of the input box. You can dynamically change the initial value of the input field by typing JavaScript in {{}}.
setter_tooltip.loading: Whether the component should show a loading indicator.
setter_tooltip.map_data_option: Use either an array of values or an object of keys mapped to arrays. Each item in your data source is mapped to each option.
setter_tooltip.mapped_value:
Use {{ currentRow }} to access the data of current row. For example, to calculate "cost per click" based on columns "cost" and "clickTimes": 
  {{ currentRow.cost / currentRow.clickTimes }}
setter_tooltip.only_run_when: Conditions that must be met before the event executes.
setter_tooltip.placeholder: The value will be shown when the input field is empty.
setter_tooltip.progress_percentage: The percentage value is between 0 and 100.
setter_tooltip.read_only: Control the status of whether the component is read only. A read only component can be selected and focused but cannot be modified.
setter_tooltip.required_field: Valid only when the switch is on.
setter_tooltip.switch_default_value: Set the initial status of the switch. You can dynamically change the default value by JavaScript.
setter_tooltip.table_only_run_when: Conditions that must be met before the event executes. Use {{ currentRow }} to access the data of current row. For example, only run when "imgSize" less than 5120: {{ currentRow.imgSize <= 5120 }}.
setter_tooltip.table_set_value:
Use currentRow to access the data of current row. For example, to set value of editableText component based on "email":  {{ currentRow.email }}.
  And also, you can set value in INSPECT of the component by using {{ table. selectedRow[n] }}: {{ table1.selectedRow[n].email }}.
setter_tooltip.table_url: Use {{ currentRow }} to access the data of current row. For example, to go to url with parameter "appid": {{ "www.example.com/#" + currentRow.appid }}.
setter_tooltip.text_value: You can choose to enter value either in Markdown mode or Plain text mode. Only links in markdown mode can be recognized. In Markdown mode, the platform supports both Markdown syntax and HTML syntax. In order to utilize both syntaxes simultaneously, it is necessary to include a blank newline between the two syntaxes.
setter_tooltip.timeline_direction: Change the direction of the timeline.
setter_tooltip.timeline_pending: Whether to show a node with a pending status.
setter_tooltip.tooltip: User can enter component tooltip here. The tooltip will be shown when it is focused. Markdown format is supported.
setter_tooltip.file_types: A list of file extensions allowed to upload. No value will permit all file types.
setter_tooltip.file_list: To show a list of selected files below the uploader. The height of uploader will change dynamically based on the length of file list.
setter_tooltip.parse_value:
Attempt to parse the selected files, with support for JSON, CSV, TSV, Excel, and TXT files.
Parsed data can be accessed via {{uploader1.parsedValue}}. Files that can not be parsed will be null in the array.
All files are available as base64 encoded strings on the value array, regardless of this option.
setter_tooltip.file_url:
Supports PDF URLs on the web, or base64 encoded data of pdf files. For example: 
{{ data:application/pdf;base64, example-data }}
setter_tooltip.scale: Scale each page to fill the width or height of the component.
setter_tooltip.scroll: Automatically locate to the beginning of each page when scrolling.
setter_tooltip.video_url: Supports most video services or a direct link to any common video file type or the base64 encoded data of video files. For example: {{ data:audio/mp4;base64,exampleDate}}

collapse.type: Collapsible list: list, all items will automatically copy the style of the first item. You can specify the component data in each item via {{ currentItem.columnName }}. Collapsible panel: each panel is independent, you can specify the component style and data of each item separately.
collapse.accordin_mode: In accordion mode, when an item is expanded, other items will collapse.

setter_tooltip.message: To retrieve the content of the message from a specific field in the data source, such as the content field, you can set it as {{item.content}}.
setter_tooltip.message_type: To set the type of the message based on a specific field in the data source, such as the type field, you can set it as {{item.type}}. We support these types: text, image, video, and audio.
setter_tooltip.message_id: To set a unique ID for each message, you can retrieve it from a specific field in the data source. If you want to retrieve it from the id field, you can set it as {{item.id}}.
setter_tooltip.replayMessageId: If it is replying to a specified message, use this field to set which message to reply to.
setter_tooltip.expandAll: Whether or not to expand all the nodes
setter_tooltip.sendTime: Set the sending time. For example, in your data source, the sending time is the sendAt field and you can set the field to {{item.sendAt}}.
setter_tooltip.senderName: Set the sender name. For example, in your data source, the sender name is the sendName field and you can set the field to {{item.sendName}}.
setter_tooltip.currentSenderId: Set the current sender id. We use this field to determine which user sends information to be displayed on the right.
setter_tooltip.senderId: Set the sender id. For example, in your data source, the sender id is the sendID field and you can set the field to {{item.sendID}}.
setter_tooltip.sendTimeFormat: Set the format of sending time. For example, hh:MM:ss.
setter_tooltip.showAvatar: Set whether to show the avatar
setter_tooltip.showName: Set whether to show the name
setter_tooltip.showSendTime: Set whether to show the send time
setter_tooltip.showFooter: Set whether to show the footer

inspect.unselected_tip2: Click on a component to select it.

chat.data_source: The data source of the chat component. Use {{actionName.data}} to use the data from your databases or APIs
chat.sender_avatar: Set the sender avatar. For example, in your data source, the sender avatar is the sendAvatar field and you can set the field to {{item.sendAvatar}}.
chat.enable_message_selec: Set whether to allow a message to be selected
chat.selection_type: Set how to select a message, left-click or right-click. When used on a mobile device, it is clicked to trigger the selection.
chat.loading_when_receivi: Set whether to display loading when receiving messages. If your message is received from action1, you can set it to {{action1.isRunning}}, and the loading status will be displayed when action1 is running.
chat.loading_when_sending: Set whether to display loading when sending messages. If your message is sent to action1, you can set it to {{action1.isRunning}}, and the loading status will be displayed when action1 is running.
chat.image_background: Set a image background. Base64 and image URL are supported

setter_tips.carousel_tips: Use {{ item }} to get value from the data source. For example, there are two attributes in the data source. They are imageUrl and url. If you want to go to different url when click image, use {{ item.url }} to set the url.
setter_tips.data_source: A data source to define image items using mapped evaluation. Use either an array of values or an object of keys mapped to arrays. For example: {{[{ x:1, y:1 },{ x:2, y:2 },...]}} . You can also use the data in actions. For example: {{ mysql1.data }}
setter_tips.img_url_array: Use {{ item.attributeName }} to get image URL from the data source.

carousel.data_source: A data source to define image items using mapped evaluation. Use either an array of values or an object of keys mapped to arrays. For example: {{[{ x:1, y:1 },{ x:2, y:2 },...]}} . You can also use the data in actions. For example: {{ mysql1.data }}

file_download.file_data: Support base64 data, raw data, mapped data of table.

variable.available_in_objects: Available in objects and arrays. The path of the attribute in the object: {{objectName.attributeName}}. The index of the value in an array: {{1}}. An array in the object: {{objectName.attributeName.1}}

slider.default_value: The initial value of the slider. You can dynamically change the initial value by typing JavaScript in {{}}.
slider.minimum: The minimum value of the slider
slider.maximum: The maximum value of the slider
slider.step_size: The minimum change unit of the slide
slider.label: The name of the field displayed to the user
slider.caption: A caption used to describe the field in detail
slider.hide_label: Set whether to display the label
slider.allow_wrapping: Set whether to allow label wrapping
slider.position: Set the position of the label relative to the component
slider.alignment: Set the alignment of the label
slider.width: When the label is on the left side of the component, set the width ratio of the label
slider.prefix_icon: The icon displayed in front of the component
slider.suffix_icon: The icon displayed after the component
slider.hide_output: Set whether to hide the value when sliding

switch_group.label: The label of the option
switch_group.value: An array of the selected options enclosed in {{. For example, {{ ["Option 1", "Option 2"] }}
switch_group.value_error: The value is duplicated. Please use unique values to avoid errors.
switch_group.caption: A caption displayed under the label
switch_group.datasource: The data source of the switch group. Use {{actionName.data}} to use the data from your databases or APIs
switch_group.default_value: An array enclosed in {{ }}. For example, {{ ["value1", "value2", "value3"] }}

range_slider.start_value: To set the minimum value of the range
range_slider.end_value: To set the maximum value of the range

audio.audio_url: Supports direct links to any common audio file type or the links to some audio services or the base64 encoded data of audio files. For example: {{ data:audio/mp3;base64,exampleDate}}

map.markers: To set markers on the map. The markers should be an array of objects with the same properties as the Default markers.
map.initial_location: When initializing the map, the default centered display position
map.default_markers: The default markers displayed when initializing the map. You can set it dynamically with the JavaScript in {{}}.
map.latitude_field_name: The latitude is taken from which property of the Initial location and Default markers objects.
map.longitude_field_name: The longitude is taken from which property of the Initial location and Default markers objects.
map.enable_add_markers: Whether to allow users to add markers by clicking on the map
map.enable_search_locati: Whether to allow users to search for location
map.enable_clustering: Whether to allow multiple markers to aggregate when the map is zoomed out

time_picker.format: A valid time format string. For more information of the format: [dayJS](https://day.js.org/docs/en/parse/string-format)
time_picker.the_span_of_the_valu: The span of the value in minutes
time_picker.show_a_clear_button_: Show a clear button when the mouse is over the component.

time_range.start_time: The initial start time of the component.
time_range.end_time: The initial end time of the component.
time_range.start_placeholder: The value will be shown when the start time field is empty.
time_range.end_placeholder: The value will be shown when the end time field is empty.

eventCalendar.event_value: Use Object enclosed in {{ to set the event value. For example, {{ {"event_name": "name1", "event_id":"id1","event_description":"description"} }}
eventCalendar.event_id: A unique ID used to identify the event
eventCalendar.title: The title of the event
eventCalendar.resource_id: The resource could be a person, a meeting room, etc. You can set a resource id and connect it to the event.
eventCalendar.resource_title: The resource name displayed in the resource view
eventCalendar.data_source: Data source of the events. A data source should be an array of objects. Every object is an event. For example, {{[{"event_name": "name1", "event_id":"id1","event_description":"description"},"event_name": "name2", "event_id":"id2","event_description":"description"} ]}}
eventCalendar.default_date: The default date when launch the app
eventCalendar.resource_grid: Whether to show a resource grid
eventCalendar.default_view: The default view when launch the app
eventCalendar.show_current_time: Set whether to show the current time line
eventCalendar.calendar_background: Set the background of the calendar
eventCalendar.event_background: Set the background of event card
eventCalendar.event_text: Set the text color of event card
eventCalendar.couldnot_drag: If you wish to drag to adjust the time range, please proceed to the preview page for the operation.
eventCalendar.draggable: Whether allow users to update the event time range by dragging to move the event
eventCalendar.resizable: Whether allow users to update the event time range and change the time span by dragging the border of an event to lengthen or shorten the time span
eventCalendar.custom_message_draggable: After dragging is disabled, the message will display when a user drags the event.
eventCalendar.custom_message_resizable: After resizing is disabled, the message will display when a user resizes the event.

table.page_index: Index of the page you wish to select.
table.index: Index of row you wish to select. The index should be an array that can be used to specify multiple rows.
table.scroll_to_the_select: Whether to scroll to the row.
table.show_thousands_separ: Whether to show the thousands separator
table.tag_label: Set the label of tags. An array will be separated to multiple tags.
table.tag_color: Set the color of tags. Use {{ write a conditional statement to set the color displayed by each tag under different conditions.
table.icon: The icon displayed in the table
table.sort_by_mapped_value: Whether to sort by mapped value. If not, we will sort based on the original data.
table.background: Set the background of column. Use {{ write a conditional statement to set the color displayed by each cell under different conditions.
table.alignment: Set the alignment of the column.
table.column_width: Set column width by numeric value. You can also adjust the column width by dragging in the frame. After adjustment, the value of this configuration item will also change accordingly
table.width: Set the adaptation method of column width.
table.disable_user_selecti: Whether to disable user selection. If disabled, you can select rows by control the table component by event handler.
table.refresh: Whether to show the refresh icon.
table.download_row_data: Whether to show the download raw data icon.
table.column_setting: Whether to show the column setting. Column setting will allow users to set the columns to display and the column sort. This setting does not change the table data.
table.cell_overflow: How to display when cell overflow.
table.total_row_count: The number of rows used to count the page number.
table.next_cursor: An identifier used to locate the next starting point of a set of data, in order to paginate and retrieve data in batches
table.has_next_page: A boolean used to indicate whether there is another page of data available. It can help us better control data retrieval in paginated queries and optimize query performance
table.filters: An array of object enclosed in {{ }}. For example, {{ [{"**id**":"name of the column to filter", "**value**"："the value to match", "**filterFn**":"contains, equals, ..."}] }}. We support these filterFn: "equalTo", "notEqualTo", "contains", "doesNotContain", "lessThan", "notLessThan", "moreThan", "notMoreThan", "empty", "notEmpty", "before", "after".
table.whether_allow_users_: Whether allow users to select a cell
table.supported_in_the_row: Supported in the row single selection mode. After enabling it, click an area other than the table to unselect the row.

setter_tips.previous_cursor: Use the action data to set the previous cursor. For example,  {{ pageInfo.startCursor }}

input.show_visible_button: To set whether to show the visible button

recording.start_button_text: The text displayed on the button when the recording is not started
recording.stop_button_text: The text displayed on the button when recording
recording.clear_button_text: The text displayed on the button when the recording is completed

setter_tips.leftMessageColor: Set the color of the messages on the left
setter_tips.rightMessageColor: Set the color of the messages on the right
setter_tips.toolbar-replay: Set whether to show a reply button when select a message.
setter_tips.toolbar-delete: Set whether to show a delete button when select a message.

setter_message.choose_at_least: Please choose at lease {{ min }} options.

map.zoom: Please set a value between 1 and 22

upload.size_exceed: Files over 500MB may fail to parse.
upload.single_file: Only a single file is allowed.

code.write_code: Write your code here. Use JavaScript inside of {{ }}

model_tips.change_layout_message: After changing the layout, all data will be cleared. This operation can't be recovered, please confirm
model_tips.delete_section_message: After hiding, the data in this section will be cleared. This operation can't be recovered, please confirm

tooltips.show_fold_icon: Show a button to collapse or expand the panel
tooltips.view_path: A string after example.com/app/page/ to access this view
tooltips.auto_canvas_width: The width of page as a percentage of the browser width.

validate_message.email: Please enter a valid email address
validate_message.max_length: Must be no more than {{ number }} characters
validate_message.min_length: Must be at least {{ number }} characters
validate_message.max_size: The file size can't exceed {{maxSize }} {{ type }}.
validate_message.min_files: At least {{ minFiles }} files are required.
validate_message.min_size: The file size can't be less than {{minSize }} {{ type }}.

onboarding_app.name: Onboarding app
onboarding_app.description: Follow ILLA's tutorial to learn how to build an app.

templates_action.fork_description: Fork this template as a new app

templates_description.form: Use form and input components to create form apps.
templates_description.list: Use a list component to display and manage information

onboarding_app.modify_action_description_modify:
Modify action to get data. We can use {{input1.value}} to get the data entered into the input component. 

select * 
from users
join orders
on users.id = orders.id
where {{!input1.value}} or lower(users.name) like '%{{input1.value.toLowerCase()}}%'
onboarding_app.modify_action_description_click: Click Save and then click Run
onboarding_app.display_data_description_select: Select the table on the frame
onboarding_app.display_data_description_modify: Modify the data source on the right panel. We can use {{postgresql1.data}} to get the data.
onboarding_app.event_handler_description_1: Select the button on the frame
onboarding_app.event_handler_description_4: Change the action to trigger action
onboarding_app.test_it_description: Input a user name you want to search for and click the button
onboarding_app.congratulations_description: You just built your first app. If you have any questions during use, you can contact us via <0>Discord</0>.
onboarding_app.event_handler_description_all:
1. Add an event handler
2. Click the event handler
3. Change the action to trigger action
4. Change the Query to postgresql1

deployment.title: Flexible deployment
deployment.introduction: ILLA provides two ways to deploy. Developers can use the ILLA Cloud to quickly start building their apps on any device. We also provide ILLA CLI for free with better security to ensure data safety.

illa-cloud.title: ILLA Cloud
illa-cloud.des: Try one-click deployment and enjoy the easiest deployment experience

illa-CLI.title: ILLA CLI
illa-CLI.des: The fastest and easiest way to self-host ILLA

kubernetes.title: Kubernetes
kubernetes.des: Deploy ILLA into Kubernetes by using ILLA Helm chart

description_title.add_storage: You are going to add {{changeNum}} GB storage. Once confirmed, we will immediately deduct the payment for the new storage for this billing cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.remove_storage: You are going to remove {{changeNum}} GB storage. Once confirmed, the changes will take effect in the next billing cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.update_plan_year: You are going to update to a yearly payment plan. Once confirmed, the change will take effect from the start of the next billing cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.update_plan_monthly: You are going to update to a monthly payment plan. Once confirmed, the change will take effect from the start of the next billing cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.add_license: You are going to add {{changeNum}} licenses. Once confirmed, we will immediately deduct the payment for the new licenses for this billing cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.remove_license: You are going to remove {{changeNum}} licenses. Once confirmed, the changes will take effect in the next billing cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.add_traffic: You are going to add {{changeNum}}GB traffic. Once confirmed, we will deduct the cost of the additional traffic immediately. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.subscribe_storage: You are going to subscribe to ILLA Cloud Plus. We will automatically deduct the fees from your account at the beginning of each payment cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.subscribe_license: You are going to subscribe to ILLA Drive. We will automatically deduct the fees from your account at the beginning of each payment cycle. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.update_plan_increase_license: You are going to add {{changeNum}} licenses and update your subscription period. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.update_plan_remove_license: You are going to remove {{changeNum}} licenses and update your subscription period. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.update_plan_increase_storage: You are going to add {{changeNum}} GB storage and update your subscription period. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.update_plan_remove_storage: You are going to remove {{changeNum}} GB storage and update your subscription period. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.unsubscribe_license: You are going to unsubscribe ILLA Cloud Plus. After cancellation, starting from the next billing cycle, the Plus features will no longer be accessible. <0>Learn more</0>
description_title.unsubscribe_storage: You are going to unsubscribe ILLA Drive storage. After cancellation, starting from the next billing cycle, the storage capacity will be restored to 100MB. <0>Learn more</0>

description.add_storage: Calculation rules using a monthly storage subscription as an example: Let's consider a scenario where you initially subscribed to 5 GB starting from March 14th, and the billing cycle spans from the 14th of this month to the 13th of next month. On May 10th, you decide to add 1 GB. At that point, there were 4 days remaining until the end of the current cycle on May 13th (which totals 30 days from April 14th to May 13th). To calculate the adjusted payment, we will deduct the cost of 1 GB, which amounts to approximately $0.99, proportionate to the duration of 4 days within the 30-day cycle. Therefore, the deduction is estimated as 1 license * $0.99 / 30 days * 4 days, resulting in approximately $0.132. Starting from the next billing cycle, all storage fees will be consolidated and paid together. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our user <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.remove_storage: If the storage capacity occupied by your files exceeds the subscribed storage capacity at the start of the next billing cycle, all files will be disabled until you delete files or increase the storage capacity within the available range. For more information, please refer to our  <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.update_plan_year: Starting from the next period, the subscription will be changed to an annual subscription, and the fees will be automatically deducted based on the annual subscription pricing. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.update_plan_monthly: Starting from the next period, the subscription will be changed to a monthly subscription, and the fees will be automatically deducted based on the monthly subscription pricing. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.add_license: Calculation rules using a monthly license subscription as an example: Let's consider a scenario where you initially subscribed to 5 licenses starting from March 14th, and the billing cycle spans from the 14th of this month to the 13th of next month. On May 10th, you decide to add 1 additional license. At that point, there were 4 days remaining until the end of the current cycle on May 13th (which totals 30 days from April 14th to May 13th). To calculate the adjusted payment, we will deduct the cost of 1 license, which amounts to approximately $10, proportionate to the duration of 4 days within the 30-day cycle. Therefore, the deduction is estimated as 1 license * $10 / 30 days * 4 days, resulting in approximately $1.33. Starting from the next billing cycle, all license fees will be consolidated and paid together. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.remove_license: If the number of users with editing permissions exceeds the number of licenses at the start of the next billing cycle, all users except the owner will be disabled until you remove members or increase the number of licenses within the available range. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.add_traffic: After successful deduction, your traffic will increase in real-time. Once the traffic is used, the fees cannot be refunded. Unused traffic can be refunded in units of GB. For example, if you purchase 10GB of traffic and use 4.5GB, you can apply for a refund of 5GB. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.subscribe_storage_yearly: You are going to subscribe to the annual subscription of ILLA Drive storage. We will automatically deduct the fees from your account at the beginning of each payment cycle. The actual amount deducted depends on how much storage capacity you have subscribed in GB. For example, if you start your first subscription on February 25, 2023, with an annual subscription fee of $9.9 per GB, and you have a total of 3 GB, we will deduct $29.7 on February 25, 2023. If you add 2 GB on March 25, 2023, we will first deduct the remaining 11 months' payment on March 25, 2023. Then, by February 25, 2024, we will deduct the payment for 5 GB, which is (2+3)*$9.9=$49.5. If you wish to reduce storage or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.subscribe_storage_monthly: You are going to subscribe to the monthly subscription of ILLA Drive storage. We will automatically deduct the fees from your account at the beginning of each payment cycle. The actual amount deducted depends on how much storage capacity you have subscribed in GB. For example, if you start your first subscription on February 25, 2023, with an monthly subscription fee of $0.99 per GB, and you have a total of 3 GB, we will deduct $2.97 on February 25, 2023. If you add 2 more licenses on March 21, 2023, we will first deduct the remaining 5 days' payment on March 21, 2023. Then, by March 25, 2023, we will deduct the payment for 5 licenses, which is (2+3)*$0.99=$4.95. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.subscribe_license_yearly: You are going to subscribe to the annual subscription of ILLA Cloud Plus. We will automatically deduct the fees from your account at the beginning of each payment cycle. The actual amount deducted depends on the number of licenses you have. For example, if you start your first subscription on February 25, 2023, with an annual subscription fee of $100 per license, and you have a total of 3 licenses, we will deduct $300 on February 25, 2023. If you add 2 more licenses on March 25, 2023, we will first deduct the remaining 11 months' payment on March 25, 2023. Then, by February 25, 2024, we will deduct the payment for 5 licenses, which is (2+3)*$100=$500. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.subscribe_license_monthly: You are going to subscribe to the monthly subscription of ILLA Cloud Plus. We will automatically deduct the fees from your account at the beginning of each payment cycle. The actual amount deducted depends on the number of licenses you have. For example, if you start your first subscription on February 25, 2023, with an monthly subscription fee of $12 per license, and you have a total of 3 licenses, we will deduct $36 on February 25, 2023. If you add 2 more licenses on March 21, 2023, we will first deduct the remaining 5 days' payment on March 21, 2023. Then, by March 25, 2023, we will deduct the payment for 5 licenses, which is (2+3)*$12=$60. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.update_plan_increase_license: The fees will be automatically deducted based on the updated number of licenses and the pricing of new billing cycle from the next period. This time, we will deduct the payment for the increased licenses according to the current billing cycle. Calculation rules of increasing licenses using a monthly license subscription as an example: Let's consider a scenario where you initially subscribed to 5 licenses starting from March 14th, and the billing cycle spans from the 14th of this month to the 13th of next month. On May 10th, you decide to add 1 additional license. At that point, there were 4 days remaining until the end of the current cycle on May 13th (which totals 30 days from April 14th to May 13th). To calculate the adjusted payment, we will deduct the cost of 1 license, which amounts to approximately $10, proportionate to the duration of 4 days within the 30-day cycle. Therefore, the deduction is estimated as 1 license * $10 / 30 days * 4 days, resulting in approximately $1.33. Starting from the next billing cycle, all license fees will be consolidated and paid together. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.update_plan_remove_license: The fees will be automatically deducted based on the updated number of licenses and the pricing of new billing cycle from the next period. If the number of users with editing permissions exceeds the number of licenses at the start of the next billing cycle, all users except the owner will be disabled until you remove members or increase the number of licenses within the available range. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.update_plan_increase_storage: The fees will be automatically deducted based on the updated storage and the pricing of new billing cycle from the next period. This time, we will deduct the payment for the increased storage according to the current billing cycle. Calculation rules using a monthly storage subscription as an example: Let's consider a scenario where you initially subscribed to 5 GB starting from March 14th, and the billing cycle spans from the 14th of this month to the 13th of next month. On May 10th, you decide to add 1 GB. At that point, there were 4 days remaining until the end of the current cycle on May 13th (which totals 30 days from April 14th to May 13th). To calculate the adjusted payment, we will deduct the cost of 1 GB, which amounts to approximately $0.99, proportionate to the duration of 4 days within the 30-day cycle. Therefore, the deduction is estimated as 1 license * $0.99 / 30 days * 4 days, resulting in approximately $0.132. Starting from the next billing cycle, all storage fees will be consolidated and paid together. If you wish to reduce licenses or make other changes to the subscription, please update it before the start of the next period. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>
description.update_plan_remove_storage: The fees will be automatically deducted based on the updated storage and the pricing of new billing cycle from the next period. If the storage capacity occupied by your files exceeds the subscribed storage capacity at the start of the next billing cycle, all files will be disabled until you delete files or increase the storage capacity within the available range. For more information, please refer to our <0>Privacy Policy</0> and <1>Terms of Service</1>

sub_suc.you_can_now_invite_m: It will take effect in a few minutes. You can invite members and start using the advanced features later. Go ahead and give it a try!
sub_suc.you_can_now_upload_m: It will take effect in a few minutes.  You can now upload more files.
sub_suc.we_have_added_the_li: It will take effect in a few minutes. We have added the licenses for you. Any changes to the subscription period will take effect from the next billing cycle.
sub_suc.we_have_added_the_st: It will take effect in a few minutes. We have added the storage for you. Any changes to the subscription period will take effect from the next billing cycle.

upgrade_now_admin.this_feature_is_avai: This feature is available for Plus users only. To use it, please upgrade to Plus. By upgrading to Plus, you will also have access to the following features.
upgrade_now_admin.add_unlimited_viewer: Add unlimited viewer members for FREE
upgrade_now_admin.insufficient_license_description: To invite more editors, please increase licenses first. All members of your team could use the features for ILLA Cloud Plus. The specific access to each feature depends on the role of each member.

expired.owner: Your subscription has expired. To continue using, please renew it.
expired.others: Your account has been disabled because the team's subscription has expired.
expired.all_members_except_f_not_owner: Your team doesn't have enough licenses. Please contact your team owner.

blank_page.insufficient_license_disable: Your account has been disabled due to insufficient team licenses. Please contact the team Owner for assistance.

upgrade_not_admin.insufficient_license_description: To invite more editors, please connect your admin to increase licenses first.

storage_insufficient.owner_description: In order to store files normally, please increase the storage  in time.
storage_insufficient.not_owner_description: In order to store files normally, please contact your administrator to increase storage capacity in time.

traffic_insufficient.owner_description: In order to access files normally, please increase the traffic capacity in time.
traffic_insufficient.not_owner_description: In order to access files normally, please contact your administrator to increase traffic capacity in time.

cancel_confirm.description: After cancellation, your team will revert to the free plan starting from the next billing cycle. The features included in the subscription plans will no longer be accessible.
cancel_confirm.title: Cancel the subscription?

change_confirm.description: Once reduced, the changes will take effect in the next billing cycle. If there are resources that exceed the newly allocated capacity, all resources may become inaccessible.
change_confirm.title: Change plan?
